item.title: Bitboards in Rust
item.description: Introduction Hello there! I haven’t posted in a while because I was working on my chess engine. Specifically, representing the pieces as bitboards. Now you may ask what a bitboard is. You can use bitboards to represent a chess board in a piece-centric manner. What is so special about bitboards then? Doesn’t a piece list do the same thing? Well, representing a bitboard only requires a single unsigned 64 bit integer!
